info.game_comments:
New set.
Time-lapse transition from old set to new set.

(1, 1).clue: The 1842 Webster-Ashburton Treaty fixed Maine's border with this "New" province

(2, 1).clue: This show's theme song says, "I'm living on the air in Cincinnati..."

(3, 1).clue: The Time Almanac reports this largest city in Louisiana is home to fewer than 1,000 Native Americans, Eskimos & Aleuts

(4, 1).clue: Logically, Alcoa's new corporate headquarters, completed in 1998, used 800,000 pounds of this

(5, 1).clue: The latest info on a story in a newscast

(6, 1).clue: Tsai Shen, a god of wealth of this country may appear with Fu Shen, a god of happiness

(1, 2).clue: This military alliance was formed in 1949 by Canada, the U.S. & 10 European countries

(2, 2).clue: Bea Arthur played this title character, an outspoken liberal, on '70s TV

(3, 2).clue: Lead would melt on the surface of this closest planet to Earth; it's like 800 degrees there

(4, 2).clue: Isbank, "Turkey's Bank", began in a 2-story building in Ankara & is now in 3 towers in this city

(5, 2).clue: (Cheryl & Sarah of the Clue Crew demonstrate.)  This term for diverting attention from someone else comes from the theater faux pas I've just committed

(6, 2).clue: Yama is a god of death in Vedic traditions of this religion

(1, 3).clue: On a tour of Canada in 1967, French president Charles de Gaulle called for the independence of this province

(2, 3).clue: In the '70s Shaun Cassidy & Parker Stevenson played these teen detectives

(3, 3).clue: ZIP codes in this commonwealth run from 00601 in Adjuntas to 00698 for Yauco

(4, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Chicago.)  Behind me is the new headquarters of this giant company; sorry, Seattle

(5, 3).clue: The financial cost of maintaining something in proper condition

(6, 3).clue: Depicted as a snake, Wadd is a moon god from pre-Islamic times on this peninsula

(1, 4).clue: This institution, the NFB, founded by Parliament in 1939, added an animation department in 1942

(2, 4).clue: She played "Police Woman" Sgt. Pepper Anderson

(3, 4).clue: Norman Thomas did this 6 times: in 1928, 1932, 1936, 1940, 1944 & 1948

(4, 4).clue: Lew Wasserman built "The Black Tower", the longtime HQ of this movie company once owned by MCA

(5, 4).clue: The 20th letter of the alphabet used by Sophocles

(6, 4).clue: Associated with artists & craftsmen, Ptah was a creator god of these ancient people

(1, 5).clue: This Canadian company, formerly British, is the oldest chartered company in the world

(2, 5).clue: Lisa Hartman played the title character on this sitcom, a spin-off from "Bewitched"

(3, 5).clue: He died in 1742, missing the fulfillment of his prediction of a comet seen in 1682 returning in 1758

(4, 5).clue: In 2000 software giant Adobe Systems began building a third tower in this city's downtown

(5, 5).clue: Geographically, Michiganders know it's the U.P.

(6, 5).clue: Pryderi is the son of this ancient people's god Pwyll & Rhiannon is his consort

(1, 1).clue: British chemist Smithson Tennant did it in 1804

(2, 1).clue: Not surprisingly, this Kubrick classic won the 1968 Academy Award for Special Visual Effects

(3, 1).clue: A major promoter of the Erie Canal, De Witt Clinton was governor of this state in 1825 when it was opened

(4, 1).clue: By 1924 the phrase "My Flag" in the Pledge of Allegiance had been changed to this longer phrase
(4, 1).correct response: The Flag of the United States of America

(6, 1).clue: A shiv is this type of weapon

(1, 2).clue: It's the chemical symbol for iridium, not iron

(2, 2).clue: Often used to create lighting special effects, it's a flashing device for intermittent illumination

(3, 2).clue: It's the only Great Lake besides Lake Erie that bears the name of an Indian tribe

(4, 2).clue: This large draft horse named for a river in central Scotland was developed from a Flemish stallion in the 18th century

(6, 2).clue: This British term for a police spy or informer sounds like it's related to drugs, but it dates from the mid-19th C.

(1, 3).clue: Traces of iridium in rocks lend credence to the theory that this cosmic event led to the dinosaurs' extinction

(2, 3).clue: This former art director for Roger Corman directed the FX-heavy hits "True Lies" & "The Abyss"

(3, 3).clue: By population, Erie is the third-largest city in this state

(4, 3).clue: Chapter 3 of this Steinbeck novel begins, "Adam Trask was born on a farm on the outskirts of a little town..."

(6, 3).clue: Often following "head", this term for someone in charge comes from the Japanese for "squad leader"

(1, 4).clue: For use in jewelry & pen points, iridium is combined with this other silver-white metal

(2, 4).clue: 5-letter word for an explosive used to lend realism to cinematic gunplay

(3, 4).clue: The water in this river flows 35 miles from Lake Erie to Lake Ontario

(4, 4).clue: The surface of this planet's moon Io is believed to be mottled by molten sulfur beds & active volcanoes

(6, 4).clue: If you hang a Ralph or hang a Louie, you're not dispensing justice but doing this

(2, 5).clue: He's the groundbreaking FX master who created the effects for "Jason and the Argonauts"

(3, 5).clue: Reporting his 1813 naval battle on Lake Erie, he remarked, "We have met the enemy and they are ours"

(4, 5).clue: The name of these rhythmic, 24-hour biological cycles comes from the Latin for "about day"

(6, 5).clue: An equine extremity is part of this old-timey slang word for a dancer

(0, 0).clue: This brand won a top prize at the 1893 Chicago Expo & has carried the award in its name ever since
